title: URL Parser Online - URL Analysis Tool
description: A comprehensive online URL parsing tool that provides an intuitive interface to analyze and understand the various components of URLs, while popularizing HTTP-related knowledge.
keywords: URL parser,URL analysis,HTTP tools,online tools,URL components,query parameters

header.title: URL Parser Online
header.subtitle: URL Analysis Tool
header.description: Analyze and understand the components of URLs

parser.title: URL Parser
parser.inputPlaceholder: Enter URLs to parse, supports multiple URLs (one per line)
parser.privacyModeHelp: When enabled, URLs containing sensitive information will not be saved to history

result.title: Parse Result
result.empty: Please enter a URL to parse

compare.title: URL Comparison Analysis
compare.noUrls: Please select at least 2 URLs to compare
compare.maxUrls: You can select a maximum of 3 URLs to compare

knowledge.title: URL Structure Guide
knowledge.description: Learn about URL components and understand the anatomy of Uniform Resource Locators

urlStructure.title: Complete URL Structure
urlStructure.description: The complete syntax structure of URLs and meaning of each component

scheme.title: Scheme (Protocol)
scheme.description: Defines the protocol used to access the resource, such as http, https, ftp, mailto
scheme.details: Common: http(80), https(443), ftp(21), ws(80), wss(443)

authority.title: Authority Component
authority.description: Contains user info, hostname, and port number for resource identification

host.title: Host (Domain/IP)
host.description: Identifies the server by domain name or IP address, the most critical URL part
host.details: Can be domain(example.com), IPv4(192.168.1.1) or IPv6([::1])

port.title: Port Number
port.description: Specifies the service port on the server, uses protocol default when omitted

path.title: Path Component
path.description: Specifies the exact location of resource on server, similar to filesystem path

query.title: Query Parameters
query.description: Key-value pairs starting with ? to pass additional information to server
query.details: Format: ?key1=value1&key2=value2, special characters need URL encoding

fragment.title: Fragment Identifier
fragment.description: Starting with # for in-page navigation, typically points to specific page sections
fragment.details: Client-side only, not sent to server, e.g., #section1

userinfo.title: User Information
userinfo.description: Contains username and password for authentication, rarely used in modern apps
userinfo.details: Format: username:password@, not recommended due to security concerns

encoding.title: URL Encoding Rules
encoding.description: Special characters must be percent-encoded to ensure proper URL transmission
encoding.details: Space→%20, Chinese→UTF-8 encoding, reserved chars like ?→%3F

relative.title: Relative URLs
relative.description: Path references based on current page location, simplifying URL writing

standards.title: URL Standards
standards.description: Follows RFC 3986 and other international standards for URL uniformity and compatibility
standards.details: Max length typically limited to 2048 chars, supports internationalized domain names

error.networkError: Network error, please try again later

footer.copyright: © 2024 URL Parser Online. All rights reserved.
